com.logitopia.jmortar.core.service

Interface Service

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractService

    public interface Service
    The Service interface defines the operations that a service can provide. All implementers are a service and must implement these methods. Any errors generated by the implemented methods should be logged and reported.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ERROR
      ERROR - The service has an error and is stuck in that state.
      static int NEW
      NEW - The service has been initialised but never started.
      static int RUNNING
      RUNNING - The service is now fully up and running.
      static int STARTING
      STARTING - The service has been started.
      static int STOPPED
      STOPPED - The service has shutdown successfully.
      static int STOPPING
      STOPPING - The service is now in the process of stopping.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      The getName method returns the name of this service.
      int getStatus()
      The getStatus method returns the status of the service.
      boolean isErrored()
      The isErrored method is a pointed accessor that determines whether the service has stopped because of an error.
      boolean isRunning()
      The isRunning method is a pointed accessor that determines whether or not the service is running.
      boolean isStopped()
      The isStopped method is a pointed accessor that determines whether the service has stopped cleanly.
      void start()
      The start method initiates the service and is responsible for setting the service status at every stage of initiation.
      void stop()
      The stop method terminates the service and sets the service status at every stage of termination.

        STARTING - The service has been started.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The getName method returns the name of this service. Whatever the name of this service is set to upon construction is what will be returned as a String.
        Returns:
        String The name of this service.

      • getStatus

        int getStatus()
        The getStatus method returns the status of the service. Whatever state the service is in when this method is executed is the value that will be returned.
        Returns:
        int The state that the service is currently in.

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        The isRunning method is a pointed accessor that determines whether or not the service is running.
        Returns:
        boolean A flag indicating whether the service is running.

      • isStopped

        boolean isStopped()
        The isStopped method is a pointed accessor that determines whether the service has stopped cleanly.
        Returns:
        boolean A flag indicating whether the service has stopped.

      • isErrored

        boolean isErrored()
        The isErrored method is a pointed accessor that determines whether the service has stopped because of an error.
        Returns:
        boolean A flag indicating whether the service has errored.

      • start

        void start()
    throws ServiceException
        The start method initiates the service and is responsible for setting the service status at every stage of initiation. The primary responsibility of this method is to ensure that this service gets from new or stopped to running.
        Throws:
        ServiceException - An exceptional state when the service is unable to start.

      • stop

        void stop()
   throws ServiceException
        The stop method terminates the service and sets the service status at every stage of termination. The primary responsibility of this method is to ensure that this service gets from running to stopped.
        Throws:
        ServiceException - An exceptional state when the service is unable to stop.
